summary: Cod is a type of fish that lives in cold, deep ocean waters. There are two main species: Atlantic cod, found in the North Atlantic, and Pacific cod, found in the northern Pacific Ocean. Cod has white, flaky meat with a mild taste, making it a popular food worldwide. Its liver is used to make cod liver oil, which is rich in vitamins and omega-3 fatty acids. Young Atlantic cod is known as scrod, and cod is often used in British dishes like fish and chips.
title: Cod
